definition: concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: Little Cat listened to Old Cat's words and begin to fish intently.
sentences.chinese: 小猫听了老猫的话，就一心一意地钓鱼。

sentences.english: He was single -mindedly devoted to the hastening of freedom for the oppressed.
sentences.chinese: 他一心一意致力于早日让被压迫者获得自由。

sentences.english: As a result, Seigo began to observe his wife wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 于是，省吾开始一心一意地观察起妻子的活动。

sentences.english: They never pursue self-interests but work wholeheartedly for the revolution.
sentences.chinese: 他们从不谋求私利，而是一心一意为革命工作。

sentences.english: "Well, " said Charlotte, "I wish Jane success with all my heart;
sentences.chinese: “唔，”夏绿蒂说，“我一心一意祝吉英成功。

sentences.english: There was Dave, bending over the roses, carefully heaping mulch around every plant.
sentences.chinese: 那是大卫，弯下玫瑰，一心一意的为每一株植物护根。

sentences.english: That’s why he practices 4 hours a day. He’s dedicated.
sentences.chinese: 所以他每天需要练4个小时，一心一意的。

sentences.english: From now, I will be a student who is preparing for national college entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 从今起，我将戒除所有恶习，一心一意，考大学。

sentences.english: Xi said ice with his single-minded love with Haitian, Haitian laid down their swords.
sentences.chinese: 喜冰说着自己一心一意的爱着海天，海天放下了剑。

sentences.english: Jane really hurls herself into learning any new song, doesn't she?
sentences.chinese: 对任何新歌，简都会一心一意去学，对吗？

sentences.english: I wish Jane success with all my heart.
We will continue to dedicate ourselves to development and focus our attention on promoting economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们将继续聚精会神搞建设，一心一意谋发展。

sentences.english: He often works with undivided attention。
sentences.chinese: 他经常是一心一意的做事。

sentences.english: Well, " said Charlotte, "I wish Jane success with all my heart;
sentences.chinese: “唔，”夏绿蒂说，“我一心一意祝吉英成功。

sentences.english: Wherever I went in the three northeastern provinces, I stressed the need to concentrate on economic development.
sentences.chinese: 我在东北三省到处说，要一心一意搞建设。

sentences.english: Should she do her homework and play or serve her husband when she returns from school in the afternoon?
sentences.chinese: 晚上回来，是做完作业后玩耍还是一心一意侍奉郎君？

definition: heart and soul/wholeheartedly
to set one's heart on sth (idiom)
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
wholeheartedly/heart and soul
wholeheartedly/(to devote oneself) heart and soul
to concentrate on
see 死心塌地[si3 xin1 ta1 di4]
in two minds about sth (idiom)/half-hearted/shilly-shallying
genuine and sincere (idiom)/wholehearted
single-minded/concentrated
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
no complaints/to have no regrets
with all of one's heart
faithful unto death (i.e. Confucian ban on widow remarrying)
docile and obedient/all obedience
